title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
I have a Macbook Air A1466 (820-00165-A) that had water damage, I have cleaned the board with isopropyl and put the board back together and I noticed the below

[LIST=1]
[*]The Green light on the charge stays comes on and the fan spins
[*]The Macbook Starts up and tries to boot in to the OS (Customer put on Windows on a MAC) and then it reboots
[*]The Macbook does not turn on when on battery alone
[*]I can't boot off a USB or press D to get diagnostics
[*]Most if not all water was on the bottom of the board (Board facing the case bottom)
[/LIST]
I don't have a boardview for this motherboard. I am new to macbook repairs so please been patient with me but do know that I have some electronics experience from repairing laptops.

Thanks
Antony

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H on battery alone (no charger connected).
Also post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage on charger alone (no battery connected).

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QRUiEzxFsng2R4116acJsJGMrIgUcGmr/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
3V42_G3H 0.05 volts on battery only
3V42_G3H 3.42 volts on charger only
PPBUS_G3H 08.59 volts on charger only
PPBUS_G3H 1.45 voltage on battery only

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: Now post PPBUS_G3H voltage with both charger and battery connected.

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: Voltage on  PPBUS_G3H  with both battery and charger connected is Volts 08.59

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
So battery is not correctly recognized, or is bad.
Try first disconnecting BIL (battery indicator).
Post voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Did you try to boot USB macOS, disconnecting internal SSD?

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: The battery is charging I know this because when I plug in the charger and have the battery connected and leave it for 5 minutes I can see the voltage is higher then before when i did  a previous  testing  PPBUS_G3H  on battery only, the issue is that the macbook starts up to the operating system and then reboots in an endless cycle.

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
- Where is the Battery indicator located  (Please indicated what to look for on boardview)
- Where are the SCL/SDA Lines (Please indicated what to look for on boardview)
- I am unable to boot off USB it is not recongnised
- When plug in with charger only the macbook does not turn on, it requires battery and charger plugged  in to turn on

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
If you get 8.59V with both charger and battery connected, then battery is not charging, or is fully 100% charged.
Do you get green light on magsafe at that moment?

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: Yes Green Light on magsafe and see 3.3 volts at battery terminal

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: I have put in another batter and it shows orange charging light, I will wait to see if it charges

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: What voltage is meant to be at the battery terminal for it to charge ?

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: This one has now been resolved, it turned out they battery was faulty, I cleaned the water damaged from the motherboard as well as replacing the battery and all is now working fine.

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message:
Glad to hear is solved.
Always test with known good working parts, to avoid wasting time with working boards.

title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A1466 (3178) constantly reboots
message: I need to find donor boards, where in china do you guys get your donor boards, Also have you had any of the new macs in yet with the M1 Chip?, I doubt they are going to be repairable much!!!.
